title: Tai Po Tau Shui Wai
text:
Tai Po Tau Shui Wai () aka. Tai Po Tau Lo Wai () is a <a href="Punti">Punti</a> <a href="Walled%20villages%20of%20Hong%20Kong">walled village</a> in <a href="Tai%20Wo">Tai Wo</a>, <a href="Tai%20Po%20District">Tai Po District</a>, Hong Kong.
Administration.
Tai Po Tau Shui Wai is one of the villages represented within the Tai Po Rural Committee. For electoral purposes, Tai Po Tau Shui Wai is part of the <a href="Po%20Nga%20%28constituency%29">Po Nga</a> constituency, which was formerly represented by Chow Yuen-wai until July 2021.
History.
Tai Po Tau Shui Wai was established during the <a href="Song%20Dynasty">Song Dynasty</a> by a branch of the <a href="Tang%20Clan">Tang Clan</a> of <a href="Kam%20Tin">Kam Tin</a>. The enclosing walls were constructed during the <a href="Ming%20Dynasty">Ming Dynasty</a>. A part of the Clan later branched out and settled in <a href="Tai%20Po%20Tau%20Tsuen">Tai Po Tau Tsuen</a>.
